column3: also fixed a bug where a .disconnect was missing in GUI code.\n

Do you have any indication boost::signals is a bottleneck anywhere? Don't fix what is not broken.

Also: this doesn't seem to have thread-safe connect/disconnect, unlike boost.
@sinetek I'd suggest you split the .disconnect bugfix out of this pull request.\n
I agree in principle that I shan't fix what isn't broken. This seemed a good idea at the time. I still don't like boost that much though. I'll split the bugfix out and submit.\n

As much as i dislike boost, agreed on not changing it without good reason. However, this might be worth revisiting after a move to c++11, since that opens the door to several other lightweight implementations.\n

I'm completely sick of this "I don't like boost". Not liking boost doesn't mean that any random library or hand-rolled alternative is better. We also don't want to maintain every single thing as part of Bitcoin Core. There's a reason that utility libraries exist. Closing.\n
